F336E1E04D304FB69EC495CA88D0FBD1.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, using formal English when appropriate.

27905DA1401C46668A06EFB03BA0A88E.description: Include multimedia components and visual displays in presentations to clarify claims and findings.

26B2F7AC948742D29FC053399483FD13.description: Present claims and findings in a focused, coherent manner with pertinent descriptions, facts, details, and examples.

C607EA40E49946769E994A2625039994.description: Use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation when presenting.

4237D21ECD5B4290A198E9A4BA410523.description: Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, evaluating the soundness of the reasoning and the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

D2447E8B8880455D98C903E06C5F5F58.description: Analyze the main ideas and supporting details presented in a variety of media and formats and explain how the ideas clarify a topic, text, or issue.

50D97945E4D542A39A2190F292C1A429.description: Acknowledge with respect new information expressed by others and, when warranted, modify their own views.

13A2857286714B1A9FD0A4B15F9A56F1.description: Pose questions that elicit elaboration and respond to others’ questions and comments with relevant observations and ideas that bring the discussion back on topic as needed.

8E758FFE62D24AC896CF62435B6BB331.description: Follow rules for collegial discussions and define individual roles as needed.

6F5296E20F4144BB82DD2472A6E60F42.description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or researched assigned material; draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to reflect on ideas under discussion.

3A954B4BFB1B40B4974A68EA25B54AF7.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with a variety of partners on grade 7 topics and texts, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

75C916935D74468F84663242880B2399.description: Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., refined, respectful, polite, diplomatic, condescending).

CC9F384D60024494970F04423D45FFC2.description: Use of the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonym/antonym, analogy) to better understand each of the words.

5175E35318824D76AB91B8181EB0F03D.description: Using literary, biblical, and mythological text, interpret figurative language in context.

3688F199167742AA96D8A36D63424E13.description: Identify figurative language, word relationships, analogies, and nuances in word meanings based on grade 7 reading and content.

5ECB3AAB347047ADA6963CA656F1958F.description: Verification of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the meaning in context or in a dictionary).

D4905ED1C07A4759929AC9BF3505C0EA.description: Use of dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

5A0EC6CA631F4696A2203916A2BA3557.description: Use of common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., precede, recede, secede).

745676096623472988C1235C7BAA1D77.description: Use of context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase. For example, analyze the word’s position, part of speech, or function in a sentence to determine specific meaning of the word and how it contributes to the meaning of the sentence or paragraph.

337C2279E56E4A45B233F8FD61E16217.description: Use the following strategies consistently to determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words or phrases based on grade 7 reading and content.  Clarification: explicit instruction of  the strategies and their application required.

0CAD8C1B6D824AA094818335A838E7B4.description: Use language that expresses ideas precisely and concisely, recognizing and eliminating wordiness and redundancy.

361A71CE387D49D9AF44EA2E738A65E7.description: Use of correct spelling through editing and revision.

A9AEA57BFE8E4C119E081B04E3D3CC65.description: Use a comma to separate coordinate adjectives (e.g., It was a fascinating, enjoyable movie but not He wore an old[,] green shirt).

D287C41380124F3FAC915F5D7712683D.description: Demonstrate use of the conventions of standard English punctuation, and spelling when writing for a variety of purposes and audiences.

2C12181C26BC4E9B8B2AF6E0A6952928.description: Place phrases and clauses within a sentence, recognizing and correcting misplaced and dangling modifiers.

654AFCFBEC3A42BA93048F1B3613A807.description: Choose among simple, compound, complex, and compound-complex sentences to signal differing relationships among ideas.

4205DB2108CD4AE3B0BF02C16687FFEF.description: Explain the function of phrases and clauses in general and their function in specific sentences.

5E6AE5820331466990F865A613A7FAAC.description: Demonstrate use of the following conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

FD981168019442249EFE4A0878180391.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences  including for enjoyment and self-expression.

3BCA895A74A24BBCAB7FF8DEE8026023.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.  Clarification 1: Apply grade 7 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the same period as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history”). Clarification 2: Apply grade 7 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g. “Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims”).

21CF647BC82347BAAC01F08D751CAEA2.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding academic dishonesty and following an appropriate format for citation.

490AC411A5044C08BCD0DBA190DB589F.description: Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and generating additional related, focused questions for further research and investigation.

4150D85A4B144837A6F2DBB4CF0FF9C7.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

E79C10470C894604849804F8E1885A56.description: Use technology tools to produce and publish writing and present the relationships between information and ideas, as well as to collaborate with others.

FE3054D918A24E96898F4C7B9146AFC8.description: With guidance and support from Teachers, peers and digital resources, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed.                                                                                     Clarification: 1: Instructional use of such digital tools such as the internet, grammerly.com, spell- and grammar-check, plagiarism checkers to support more fluent student writing but not to replace original student writing.

DC578818340640DA808B912826412665.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

2A4555A68CD94AEEABCF45299C1086DC.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. Clarification 1:  Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically. Clarification 2: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters. Clarification 3: Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another. Clarification 4: Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to convey experiences and events. Clarification 5: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

2257762F45EF45508F4DAE56F0D27067.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.. Clarification 1: Introduce a topic; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/effect; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension. Clarification 2: Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples. Clarification 3: Use appropriate transitions to clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts. Clarification 4: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic. Clarification 5: Establish and maintain a formal style. Clarification 6: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the information or explanation presented.

8C8D27CBEB1243DBBBE7DC3E111834B1.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence. Clarification 1: Introduce claim(s), acknowledge alternate or opposing claims, and organize the reasons and evidence logically. Clarification 2: Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant evidence, using accurate, credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text. Clarification 3: Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among claim(s), reasons, and evidence. Clarification 4: Establish and maintain a formal style. Clarification 5: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument presented.

42E180F00BF94395925D1FD8C25E3988.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, at grade level and/or developmentally appropriate content.

89307DB0DCAE4D4FB5611751EAA94AF9.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

7B4856A19EB64C1E8297637C60066B1D.description: Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the same period as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history.

0FFB81E8F3AA45F68830F2AB4719FC13.description: Compare and contrast a written story, drama, or poem to its audio, filmed, staged, or multimedia version, analyzing the effects of techniques unique to each medium (e.g., lighting, sound, color, or camera focus and angles in a film).

F9F48A330F474B0797C754098B0C18BC.description: Analyze how an author develops and contrasts the points of view of different characters or narrators in a text.

72BA5ECA07DE4543B732B9F00400480A.description: Analyze how a drama’s or poem’s form or structure (e.g., soliloquy, sonnet) contributes to its meaning.

8FF6FCD43F91453B9629957BAD4FC69A.description: Analyze the impact of rhymes and other repetitions of sounds (e.g., alliteration) on a specific verse or stanza of a poem or section of a story or drama.

E9FD5CE295B84352B0B3B404F103104B.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings.

9D9D1C799BC243E5A3508574E9A774F5.description: Summarize a given text including theme, conflict, and resolution that is distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

59770911035E40ADAE3AA92FD1DB8E93.description: Analyze how particular elements of a story or drama interact (e.g., how setting shapes the characters or plot).

811D82869DB548AAB172727D354935AA.description: Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

FEBD094DFB8D4C21AF812C8DFF443601.description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text.

DF93957D2CC64F8CA9F918638F5D7A33.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literary nonfiction text complexity band proficiently at grade level and/or developmentally appropriate content.

F3515040BF3C4747AF8CC71691E0512B.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

9657D57423D7487FBDB8001C10EE3592.description: Analyze how two or more authors writing about the same topic shape their presentations of key information by emphasizing different evidence or advancing different interpretations of facts.

EE8F1284C99C4A2CAD9510839A49DAF9.description: Evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims.

BEB4E7E32CD644B2833FA01C3ADECB17.description: Compare and contrast a text to an audio, video, or multimedia version of the text, analyzing each medium’s portrayal of the subject (e.g., how the delivery of a speech affects the impact of the words).

9CEC7E6A87A74FC8B23E9C758ACEE022.description: Determine an author’s perspective or purpose in a text and analyze how the author distinguishes his or her position from that of others.

A443089792B8424AB5513A422A5D51A9.description: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to the whole and to the development of the ideas.

BFF8BAEB694C4E20A8FF2044B10F50E7.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

A8537647A53446F4B34E684313FB5E98.description: Summarize a given text including theme, conflict, and resolution that is distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

B283232097CE4CD2809DF61F442EB869.description: Analyze the interactions between individuals, events, and ideas in a text (e.g., how ideas influence individuals or events, or how individuals influence ideas or events).

6EB9C200C2A84E1185EAD8DB958904C9.description: Determine two or more central ideas in a text and analyze their development over the course of the text.

A99BF5188E334390B9D9CDE54B34120E.description: Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.
